title: [Large-Scale] Evaluation and Utilization Strategies for Blended Learning Design Tools in Social Education Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in designing hybrid (online/offline) education, basic proficiency with digital tools, foundational understanding of social studies curricula
context.additional_context: Establishing blended learning tool evaluation strategies in a BYOD environment to develop socially applicable educational design strategies for real-world job applications. Special emphasis is placed on strategies aligned with social studies objectives, such as multicultural understanding, civic engagement activities, and enhancing historical thinking skills.

learning_goals: Visual representation features of blended learning design tools can be utilized to systematically organize social studies learning activities, such as historical event analysis and geographic data visualization.
Methods to optimize social studies design decisions by interpreting integrated analytical data (e.g., learner engagement, conceptual understanding) within the tool can be explained.

The strengths and weaknesses of blended learning tools (e.g., support for cultural comparison activities, measurability of civic education outcomes) can be comparatively analyzed against traditional planning methods, and institutional applicability can be evaluated.

resources: Blended learning design tool platform license

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
